whatYouGet.title: What You Get with Roaya SOC

howItWorks.title: How It Works: Ingest, Detect, Respond, Report
howItWorks.subtitle: Roaya blends modern platforms (SIEM, XDR, SOAR) with analyst-led operations
howItWorks.note: Throughout the workflow, AI accelerates correlation and prioritization, while humans stay in control. AI processing uses our models on our cloud infrastructure, keeping your data private and away from public AI services.

step1.title: Ingest & Monitor
step1.description: We ingest logs and telemetry across network, servers, cloud, endpoints, and applications into a SIEM foundation. If you already use Cortex XSIAM, Splunk, or Elastic Security, we integrate with them; if not, we provide a SIEM baseline.

step2.title: Correlate & Analyze (AI-Assisted)
step2.description: Our Cortex-led approach correlates events and applies AI analytics to surface anomalies and attack patterns. Centralizing signals improves context and streamlines operations.

step3.title: Triage & Prioritization
step3.description: Alerts are triaged quickly. Machine learning reduces noise by filtering benign events and consolidating alerts into incident tickets. Analysts validate severity and remove remaining false positives.

step4.title: Investigate & Hunt
step4.description: Investigators dig deeper using threat intelligence such as Palo Alto Networks Unit 42. If enabled, threat hunting uses hypotheses and MITRE ATT&CK to uncover stealthy activity.

step5.title: Respond & Contain
step5.description: Based on your tier, we provide containment guidance or take direct action (e.g., isolate endpoints, block malicious IPs, disable compromised accounts). Actions follow pre-approved playbooks aligned to NIST SP 800-61.

step6.title: Report & Improve
step6.description: You receive incident reporting, post-incident review, and ongoing service reports (alerts, incidents, response times, trends). Reviews also drive tuning and continuous improvement.
